00017 =head1 NAME
00018 
00019 parserPopUp.pl - Pop-up menus compatible with Value objects.
00020 
00021 =head1 DESCRIPTION
00022 
00023 This file implements a pop-up menu object that is compatible
00024 with Value objects, and in particular, with the MultiAnswer object.
00025 
00026 To create a PopUp object, use
00027 
00028     $popup = PopUp([choices,...],correct);
00029 
00030 where "choices" are the strings for the items in the popup menu,
00031 and "correct" is the choice that is the correct answer for the
00032 popup.
00033 
00034 To insert the popup menu into the problem text, use
00035 
00036     BEGIN_TEXT
00037     \{$popup->menu\}
00038     END_TEXT
00039 
00040 and then
00041 
00042     ANS($popup->cmp);
00043 
00044 to get the answer checker for the popup.
00045 
00046 You can use the PopUp menu object in MultiAnswer objects.  This is
00047 the reason for the pop-up menu's ans_rule method (since that is what
00048 MultiAnswer calls to get answer rules).
00049 
00050 =cut
00051 
00052 loadMacros('MathObjects.pl');
00053 
00054 sub _parserPopUp_init {parser::PopUp::Init()}; # don't reload this file
00055 
00056 #
00057 #  The package that implements pop-up menus
00058 #
00059 package parser::PopUp;
00060 our @ISA = qw(Value::String);
00061 my $context;
00062 
00063 #
00064 #  Setup the context and the PopUp() command
00065 #
00066 sub Init {
00067   #
00068   # make a context in which arbitrary strings can be entered
00069   #
00070   $context = Parser::Context->getCopy("Numeric");
00071   $context->{name} = "PopUp";
00072   $context->parens->clear();
00073   $context->variables->clear();
00074   $context->constants->clear();
00075   $context->operators->clear();
00076   $context->functions->clear();
00077   $context->strings->clear();
00078   $context->{pattern}{number} = "^\$";
00079   $context->variables->{patterns} = {};
00080   $context->strings->{patterns}{".*"} = [-20,'str'];
00081   $context->{parser}{String} = "parser::PopUp::String";
00082   $context->update;
00083   main::PG_restricted_eval('sub PopUp {parser::PopUp->new(@_)}');
00084 }
00085 
00086 #
00087 #  Create a new PopUp object
00088 #
00089 sub new {
00090   my $self = shift; my $class = ref($self) || $self;
00091   shift if Value::isContext($_[0]); # remove context, if given (it is not used)
00092   my $choices = shift; my $value = shift;
00093   Value::Error("A PopUp's first argument should be a list of menu items")
00094     unless ref($choices) eq 'ARRAY';
00095   Value::Error("A PopUp's second argument should be the correct menu choice")
00096     unless defined($value) && $value ne "";
00097   my %choice; map {$choice{$_} = 1} @$choices;
00098   Value::Error("The correct choice must be one of the PopUp menu items")
00099     unless $choice{$value};
00100   $self = bless {data => [$value], context => $context, choices => $choices}, $class;
00101   return $self;
00102 }
00103 
00104 #
00105 #  Create the menu list
00106 #
00107 sub menu {
00108   my $self = shift;
00109   main::pop_up_list($self->{choices});
00110 }
00111 
00112 #
00113 #  Answer rule is the menu list
00114 #
00115 sub ans_rule {shift->menu(@_)}
00116 
00117 ##################################################
00118 #
00119 #  Replacement for Parser::String that takes the
00120 #  complete parse string as its value
00121 #
00122 package parser::PopUp::String;
00123 our @ISA = ('Parser::String');
00124 
00125 sub new {
00126   my $self = shift;
00127   my ($equation,$value,$ref) = @_;
00128   $value = $equation->{string};
00129   $self->SUPER::new($equation,$value,$ref);
00130 }
00131 
00132 ##################################################
00133 
00134 1;
